intro: Decalobanthus pulcher, commonly known as the beautiful spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant features showy, yellow-orange cyathia, which are specialized inflorescences typical of the genus. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Decalobanthus pulcher is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments.
